result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason J Keating

records.addlTxt: Order Modifying Conditions of Bond to allow travel 9-10-22 and return on 9-25-22.
Modifying conditions of bond

1:28 PM Defendant Jason J Keating in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Jason J Keating.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Further argument for motion from Attorney Mark Frank. States argument. Attorney Franks rebuttal. Court will consider modification on a case by case basis. If there are specific trips he is requesting defendant may due so, but will not grant a blanket modification. Defendant requested to leave the state on specific dates in September. Stated opposed. Court granted permission for the defendant to leave the State of WI from 9/10/22 through 9/24/22. Attorney Frank is to submit an order stating such. 1:42 PM
Bail/bond hearing on August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Petition and Petition for Review of Bond Conditions filed by attorney Mark Frank
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on February 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on November 22, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
Filed by Attorney Mark Frank

2:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jason J Keating in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Jason J Keating. State called witness Detective Jason Steinberg of Portage Police Department, sworn. Direct exam. Cross exam. Attorney Frank requested this hearing be adjourned to allow time for the Detective to prepare the documents he has reviewed prior to this hearing. State disagreed with argument. Court found Attorney Frank is entitled to review whatever documents were used by Detective for review for todays hearing. Court will adjourn and recall the case at the end of prelims. Documents are to be provided to Attorney Frank. 2:45/3:04 Case recalled. Appearances the same. Attorney Frank stated the defendant would like to waive the preliminary hearing. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. 3:10 PM
Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff
Copy of discovery letter to Attorney Frank from ADA Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
to Reschedule Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Mark Frank
Preliminary Hearing 7-6-22 at 2:00 pm - notice given to defendant by clerk
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason J Keating in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Jason J Keating. Attorney Frank requested a preliminary hearing. Waived the time limits for the hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
